titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Military ceremony speech transcript 1977.608
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-17T11:20-0500

did.abstract: Transcript of a speech given by an unidentified Brooklyn municipal representative regarding the presentation of a musket to a solder in an unidentified company of light infantry. The speech implies that the soldier had fought in the Revolutionary War. It is undated, but is presumed to date from circa 1800.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Military ceremony speech transcript, 1977.608, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
